I think it goes without saying that anyone who plays games on PC needs to play the half-life series.
Nice.

I remember playing Half-Life 2 on the Orange Box when I was younger and not really being interested in it's pacing of story and puzzles. After finally purchasing the Complete Valve pack just to play all of Valve's game through 2020, I decided to finally touch Half-Life's complete story. Half-Life 2's story, characters, world building and graphics surprised me and indulged me to continue to blast through the game being interested and jaw dropped on everything Valve did right.

Minor and major details are spread everywhere between body and facial animations, level designs and it's dialogue. Major characters speak like they actually care about the downfall of Earth and how thankful of Gorden they are for helping the resistance and how much they care about him. 

The entire time I could look at the different environments and situations that have or were occurring and be able to almost instantly put together what has happened in this area or to these people, it's feel so refreshing to see Alyx every time you see her because with each time she appears you can actually feel something for her as she helps you clear through waves of Combine and shares her thoughts and feelings about the world and characters you meet.

This game overall makes me feel like a badass as I blast through Combine. Actually seeing how my actions make a difference to the world are great, unlike others games that make your actions feels more like dints into the story than major hits. The graphics still hold up and are incredibly optimised. Gameplay at times feels refreshing and great with every new weapon you collect but in time you sort realise its frustrating to constantly switch through weapons like the Gravity Gun and the Crowbar to destroy supply caches and obstacles when you haven't got your quickswap set to neither of them. Enemies and other AI are incredibly stupid whilst Combine just stands in groups and lines waiting for you to kill them and rebels constantly stand in your way in tight walking spaces and doors. 

But besides these flaws, Half-Life 2 holds up incredibly well and doesn't fail to interest me despite how old it is. Truly a masterpiece in storytelling and development in world building and characters. It definitely deserve the praise it still gets today and I cannot wait until Half-Life: Alyx finally releases. 9/10 would crowbar an entire army of alien invaders again.

Although I haven't really played half life 1 (because i played the remake "black mesa") Half Life 2 is a masterpiece and should carry on from generations from now on. What I love about this game (and the other HLs in general) is the balance of story and gameplay its not like your shitty CoD World War II Campaign no its a campaign that has a good balance of gameplay and story, you basically understand the story as you are playing it. Even if you aren't a Valve fanboy like I am, still give it a try and it might change your mind. Oh yeah, also it can run on pretty much any modern system so..... buy it already!
